column1: Conjunctivitis#Conjunctivitis(Pink eye) is an inflammation of the transparent membrane that lines the eyelid and eyeball. It is most often caused by a viral infection.  Because it can be contagious
column2: getting an early diagnosis and taking certain precautions can help limit its spread.

column1: Diarrhea#Diarrhea — loose watery and possibly more-frequent bowel movements — is a common problem. It may be present alone or be associated with other symptoms
column4: abdominal pain or weight loss. Luckily
column6: lasting no more than a few days. But when diarrhea lasts beyond a few days into weeks
column7: it usually indicates that there's another problem — such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) or a more serious disorder
column9: celiac disease or inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).

column1: Headaches#Headache is pain in any region of the head. Headaches may occur on one or both sides of the head
column2: be isolated to a certain location
column3: radiate across the head from one point
column4: or have a viselike quality. A headache may appear as a sharp pain
column5: a throbbing sensation or a dull ache. Headaches can develop gradually or suddenly
column6: and may last from less than an hour to several days.

column1: Mononucleosis#Infectious mononucleosis (mono) is often called the kissing disease. The virus that causes mono (Epstein-Barr virus) is spread through saliva. You can get it through kissing
column2: but you can also be exposed by sharing a glass or food utensils with someone who has mono.

column1: allergies#Allergies occur when your immune system reacts to a foreign substance such as pollen
column2: bee venom or pet dander or a food that doesn't cause a reaction in most people. Your immune system produces substances known as antibodies. When you have allergies
column3: your immune system makes antibodies that identify a particular allergen as harmful
